Click Turn it on

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1454].
  {panel}

I created a couple of SD customers, that are not jira users, for our restricted jira service desk and:

- they did not receive any email from jira service desk
- if they send an email to the JSD mail account (mail configuration is set as ON), no request is opened.

Note that customers that are also SD agents can open requests via email without any problems.
fields.summary: SD customers not able to open a request via email

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1453].
  {panel}

In our JIRA Service Desk, when an agent sends a comment, the status in the workflow does not change.
However, when the agent is making a comment to a user, the user does not receive any notification.
When the user is making a comment, the agent receives the notification.
The user only receives a notification when the agen clicks on the button "Respond to customer".
I have checked in the settings, for issue commented, all watchers, current assignee and the reporter are receiving a notification.
I have checked with the notification helpder as well, the user should receive a notification for issues commented.

Another strange issue is if a third participant is making a comment, the user receives this comment.
The user simply does not receive any comments coming from the agent (assignee).

Where could I have forgotten to set something ?

Thanks in advance for your help !
fields.summary: [No notifications sent to user after a comment from an agent]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1449].
  {panel}


Include in Find a Solution results suggested request types for new request creation


I am the administrator of multiple Service Desks with many Request Types:
* I would like for the Find a Solution box to suggest request types for new requests to be created in.
** "It would be helpful if it searches the request types too as when you have a bunch of service desks it would be hard to find which one is the right place for it."
* I should be able to set a default Request Type that will show if the search returns no matches. 


I am a customer using a Service Desk Portal containing multiple Service Desks with a many Request Types: 
* I would like to use the Find a Solution box to search for solutions and if none are found, create a new request by selecting a suggested Request Type.
** "Which one do I choose?"
fields.summary: Include in Find a Solution results suggested request types for new request creation

h3. Problem Definition
Currently Service Desk Collaborators' can only comment internally. Usually, the comment contains the answer which Service Desk Agents have to copy the comment and add a duplicate comment to make the answer visible to customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a functionality, which allows agents to choose whether a collaborator's comment to be visible to customers.

fields.description:
When a customer uses "issueFunction in subtasksOf" as part of the JQL to define an SLA in ServiceDesk, issues created by email will not show an SLA panel.

Issues created from the Customer Portal will have the SLA panel as expected.

When issues are created via email an exception is thrown due to a conflict with Script Runner. This prevents the SLA JSON data from being generated and no SLA panel is displayed in the Issue Details view.

Issue is known to affect these versions in combination: JIRA 6.2.5, ServiceDesk 1.2.6.1, Script Runner 2.1.7.

This issue is not present with this combination of later versions: JIRA 6.3.14, Service Desk 2.2.0, and Script Runner 3.0.7.  It is not yet known which upgrade accounts for the fix.

Reported to Service Runner dev at https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-616 (only visible to the reporter).
fields.summary: ServiceDesk issues created by email do not have an SLA when using Script Runner function

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1445].
  {panel}

It seems like a regression from previous solved requests:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-830
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-55

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a JIRA Service Desk
# Import issues from CSV or create issues using JIRA Create button into the Service Desk project.
# Set the reporter to be one of your Service Desk customers

*Expected Behavior*
The issue created/imported through JIRA would be displayed under "My Requests" in the customer portal.

*Actual Behavior*
The issue is only visible through JIRA.
The Service Desk customer do not have access.

Also, any communication in the issues created/import via JIRA do not trigger an email notification to the involved people.
fields.summary: Issues created using JIRA create button, or CSV import, do not appear under "My Requests" of JIRA Service Desk. Also, the email communication does not work for those issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1443].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
* SLA for tickets won't display in the queue, while when seeing the ticket individually, they show up accordingly.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a service desk
* Create a ticket with SLA
* Open the queue to check

*Expected Result*
* SLA would be displayed in the queue

*Actual Result*
* SLA is not displayed in the queue and the following is displayed in the logs:
{noformat}
2014-03-28 04:53:03,559 ajp-bio-8009-exec-7 ERROR rzaddem 293x71346x1 18a591t 10.216.26.53 /rest/api/2/issue/SD-282/comment [servicedesk.internal.util.SafeRunner] Unable to run event handler SLA field indexing - addDocumentFieldsSearchable
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: start < stop
{noformat}

*Workaround*
* This error seems to be related with server time sync, since disabling the sync fixes the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk queues causing SLA errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1442].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
* Create a User picker field 
* On Issue Create event (Notification Scheme for SD), add the User Custom Field Value and choose the user picker field
* Add this field in the Customer Portal
* Create the SD request and fill in the user picker field with a SD customer

h5. Expected Result:
* SD customer specified in the user picker field should receive a notification when the issue gets created

h5. Actual Result:
* No notification has been received by the SD customer while reporter was able to get it.

Additional Information:
* Other notifications are working fine and received by the SD customer (user picker field)
fields.summary: Issue Creation doesn't Notify the User specified in the User picker field

We already made some small improvements to our plugins (custom fields mainly) so they can be used in JSD too, but it is hard without having either a public API or the source code.
We had also an extention do we can make JIRA tickets in the customer portal, but we would like to do more.
As more and more customers come to JSD they will need more sophisticated creation pages or dashboards.

Is there any plan on opening JSD for the developers?

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Create a new Service Desk with all default settings
# Configure Email settings to handle incoming emails
# Send a test email -> view request -> Priority field is visible
# Edit the Request Type configured for Email settings and add Priority field as a visible field
# Send another test email -> view request

h4. +Expected behavior+
Priority field is visible.

h4. +Actual behavior+
There's no Priority field.

h4. +Workaround+
You can [bulk edit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Modifying+Multiple+('Bulk')+Issues#ModifyingMultiple('Bulk')Issues-bulkedit] issues to add a priority to them. You just need to perform the following advanced JQL: {{project = YourProjectName and priority is EMPTY}}.

h4. +Facts & Figures+
* From table *jiraissue* in JIRA database, the value of Priority field is NULL.
* Enabling SQL Debugging, NULL is inserted for Priority field.
fields.summary: Requests created via email have NO priority if Priority field is added to Portal screen

h4. Summary
KB article that was created from *Create KB Article* button in Service Desk request, doesn't link the article back to the request itself

h4. Environment
*JIRA 6.3.13* and *JSD 2.2.0*

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk request
# Click the *Create KB article* button
# Complete the KB creation, and then click *Save*

h4. Expected Results
JIRA will create link from the Service Desk request to the KB article

h4. Actual Results
The link was not created
fields.summary: Create KB Article doesn't link Service Desk request with KB

fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk failing to enable after licensing in JIRA Cloud

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results:

There is a performance degradation in the Queue display, when using the clause: {{ORDER BY "Time to resolution"}}

In a large Service Desk, with more than 30000 requests, a Queue with 300 requests is taking a huge delay of 40s to return the JQL result when using {{ORDER BY "Time to resolution"}}.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Service Desk
# Populate it with 30k requests
# Set up a queue that will take more than 300 requests and add {{ORDER BY "Time to resolution"}} to the JQL of the Queue.
# Load the queue.

h3. Expected Results:

JIRA Service Desk loads the Queue without major delays.

h3. Workaround:

Remove the clause from the JQL, when removing the {{ORDER BY "Time to resolution"}} the Queue displays immediately.
fields.summary: Queue display very slow when using Time to resolution

fields.description:
The following error can be seen in the logs:
{noformat}
2015-01-12 16:50:33,640 http-bio-8443-exec-8445 ERROR test.user ... ... /servicedesk/customer/portal/1/create/1 [feature.customer.request.RequestActivityIssueListener] 
Failed to get event initiating user to set issue property 'request.public-activity.lastupdated'
{noformat}
This error is being thrown when a *renamed* user attempts to create a Service Desk request. 

At the moment there are no side effects to this error that I can detect (The request still creates without problems), other than the fact that the error is shown in the logs. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new user.
# Rename this new user.
# Log in as this new user and create a Service Desk request.
# Observe error being thrown in the logs. (But the Request gets created without issues)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Service Management*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1422].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Jira Service Management it is not possible to assign any request type to sub-task therefore sub-task is not visible for customer and customer can't receive any notification when sub-task is updated.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JSM Agent, It would be nice to be able to tag sub-tasks with a request type so that customers will receive customer facing updates and ticket transition notifications by email when the subtasks are updated.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks as an applicable issue type for Requests

fields.description:
Our Support team might create a ticket for a problem. They then will go through and change the reporter to a support customer. The new reporter does not receive notifications. 

The only fix I observed to this was to add the Support Customer to the Users group, which we don't want to do for each customer, as you might imagine.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1419].
  {panel}

Steps:

1. Go to Settings > Request types and then click Edit fields for any of request types.
2. Fill in Display names in Russian, Greek or some other language using a non-Latin alphabet. (you can copy and paste this: "Описание").
3. Save and refresh.

Result: 
Non-latin characters are lost, question marks are shown instead.

*The same problem exists for Request names.*

fields.description:
Hi,
After migration and upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0, an error is thrown when accessing a customer portal, and JSD settings page doesn't work. JIRA is working fine.

Using a PostgreSQL database, we changed from schema "public" to a named schema.
The select query works fine when table name is prefixed with the schema name.
Switching back to a "public" schema resolves the issue.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0, The default time to resolution metric is configured as the following:
- START: Issue created, Resolution: Cleared
- PAUSE ON: 
- STOP: Resolution: Set
However, when the issue gets created, the SLA is on pause. If user configures a new metric for SLA, it will work properly.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk
- Using the default configuration of SLA (Time to Resolution metric), create issue
- The SLA will be on pause, while it should start

h4. Expected Behavior
When the issue gets created, the SLA should start.

h4. Additional Information
- It misbehaves in JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0 only
!sd22.png|thumbnail!
- It works properly in JIRA Service Desk 2.1.1
!sd21.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0 Default SLA Time to Resolution metric set SLA on pause when issue gets created

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1410].
  {panel}

When a user has whitespace in the username, if he enters Service Desk Customer Portal and starts typing something, a red text saying "Something went wrong, either your query is invalid or we cannot contact the knowledge base" appears under the input field. Apparently the white space in the user name leads to an invalid REST URL, because the white space is not escaped. On the atlassian-jira.log, the following exception appears:

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1393].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Updateed 24th Jun 15}
Hi all,

We have categorised this issue as a suggestion because the email handler infrastructure we have chosen for JIRA Service Desk does not support this functionality. To allow support for the various suggested functionality for email will require a major re-work of our email handler infrastructure. This is currently not on our immediate roadmap as we are looking to deliver more requested features such as email customisation. However, the simplification of our email and configurations is something we will look into in the future, and we will be working on aligning our email configuration and behaviour closer with JIRA’s.

— JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}


*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Navigate to the "Priorities" page and set "Minor" as the Default Priority.
# Create a new Dummy ServiceDesk Project.
# Configure the Email Settings of the Project.
# Sent out an Email with High Importance(This is for Microsoft Outlook) to the ServiceDesk Email.
# Wait until the issue is processed.

*Expected Results*:
Like the Standard JIRA Incoming Mail Handler, the Email priority would be higher than the Default Priorty.

*Actual Results*:
ServiceDesk will follow the Default Priority regardless of the Email Priority.

*Notes*:
* Tested in JIRA and it works so far.
* JIRA Incoming Mail handler [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-issuecommentcreationIssue/commentcreation]
* The Header of the test email:
{noformat}
From: "xxxx" <xxxx@gmail.com>
To: <xxxx@gmail.com>
Subject: testing service desk priority
Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2015 23:35:11 +0800
Message-ID: <001d01d034c6$cf1f2c40$6d5d84c0$@gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="----=_NextPart_000_001E_01D03509.DD430880"
X-Priority: 1 (Highest)
X-MSMail-Priority: High
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook 14.0
Importance: High
Thread-Index: AdA0xqZ5ulBpecvDTB2UxWnXYaA5YQ==
Content-Language: en-us
{noformat}
fields.summary: Email Priority Header Support for ServiceDesk

  {panel}

{panel:title=Update on April 12, 2016 --  Signup is avaiable on the help center}
Hi everyone, 
The signup option is now available on the help center when there is at least one service desk project that has public signup enabled. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Cheers,
JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The Help Center link does not allow users to sign up to JSD even when all its portals have [public access enabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Configuring+public+signup#Configuringpublicsignup-Openingyourservicedeskupforpublicsignup].
 While browsing the Help Center only the login prompt is displayed, whereas the individual customer portals offer both login, and signup pages.
h3. Suggested Solution

If any customer portal allows for anonymous signup, then the option should be available when the Help Center is accessed.
fields.summary: Add public signup to portal of portals (Help Center)

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1386].
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

This is Charlie from the Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center team. We’re excited to let you know that we’re starting work on this suggestion. While we don’t have a concrete timeline on the delivery, we hope to roll it out soon and will update the status here when we have additional details.

Kind regards,

Charlie
Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of July 16, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

I would like to apologise for the lack of updates provided on this bug. Unfortunately we haven’t implemented a fix within the indicated timeframe. We are aiming to rectify this and are actively looking into providing a resolution soon. Please watch this space for updates.

Charlie, JSD Server Team
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 25th October 2018}
Hello All,

We are aware that this is important and something our customers expect. The good news is that, this is on our medium-term roadmap right now & exploring ways to make this available effortlessly.

Whilst I’d like to give you a clear timeframe for when we can deliver this, unfortunately, I cannot make such indications at this time yet. We’ll keep you posted as we progress.

Thanks again for your patience. 

Vidhu Sharma
 Product Manager - Jira Service Desk.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
The Jira Service Management invitation email and welcome email cannot be customised like other email notifications in JSM.

h3. Suggested Solution
Could you please implement the ability to customize the invitation e-mail and welcome email that is sent to JIRA Service Desk Customers. That would be great for our business needs!

Thanks!
 [~sara8]

h3. Workaround

For "Invite Users" email customization, You can follow the steps on the below KB that should help:
["Invite Users" Email Customization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/invite-users-email-customization-1044093548.html]

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1382].
  {panel}

We implement the service desk in a project to run in parallel with the vertygo SLA, and found a possible bug that causes a malfunction in the SLA Service Desk to use at the same time with the SLA Vertigo, since when the issue is completed, the SLA Service Desk is automatically opened again and if we close the issue, JIRA Service SLA starts again.

The rules in Vertygo SLA is the same of JIRA Service Desk, so, if Vertygo SLA is closed, JSD necessarily must be closed too, but it's not happened.

In attachments, we can see the JSD SLA - Triagem CSSP is concluded but, SLA - CSSP from Vertygo SLA is running.
Image 1 and 2: Vertygo SLA is different from JIRA Service Desk SLA.
Image 3: JIRA Service Desk works fine without Vertygo SLA.

It's necessary to use both add-ons, because our client need to compare the functionalities and rastreability. There is conflict using JIRA Service Desk and Vertygo SLA in the same issue?
fields.summary: SLA conflict using JIRA Service Desk and the VertygoSLA at the same time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1380].
  {panel}

*Problem description*

When configuring a Service Desk Mail Handler in *Project Settings > Email Requests*, there is no setting that allows us to decide whether we want to use the mail handler to:
# both create new issues and add comments to existing issues
# only create new issues
# only add comments to existing issues

As of now, only the 1st option is available.

This is a problem for customers who want to use the Mail Handler to only create new issues, or only add comments to existing tickets. As a result, some customers decided to use the JIRA Core Mail Handler configured in ⚙ > System > Incoming Mail, since this mail handler is more customizable. 

That mail handler is unfortunately not a proper mail handler to use with Service Desk projects, since it was originally designed for JIRA users (users with a JIRA license) and not for customers (users without a license). Therefore, when using the JIRA Core Mail Handler, it is necessary to provide as many licenses as customers (while the Service Desk Mail Handler does not require any license for customers).

*Suggested solution*

Make the Service Desk handler more customizable, so that we can configure it to either add comments, create new issues, or perform both actions.
fields.summary: Service Desk Mail Handler: Create a way to disable comments from email vs creating issues from email and vice versa

Great news - The ability to set Priority schemes in Jira Service Desk project(s) is now available with Jira Service Desk version 3.10. To find out more about this feature, check out our release notes [here.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-10-x-release-notes-941610925.html#JIRAServiceDesk3.10.xreleasenotes-ver]

Due to the missing functionality of having "Priority per project" in JIRA (JRA-3821), the JIRA default priority is useless when you have more than the default priorites. Which is a need if you have a big JIRA instance and many projects.

I think the main solution must be made in JIRA core rather than in Service Desk but respect the workaround from the linked issue will be a quick fix for the customer portal.

And maybe the SD Team can give the linked issue some higher rank in the Backlog.

================================================================================

This ticket is a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1380, therefore closing it as duplicate.

================================================================================

Right now if we want to Turn on the email channel to "Create Issues and comments from Email" in JIRA Service Desk then system shows the error below:

"The associated request type must have both the Summary and Description fields as visible fields, and all the other visible fields, if any, must be optional." (please see the attached image)

But our current request types have Summary and Description fields but any one of the other fields is required. For a new request we have to follow this convention. But for posting comment we don't need to follow it. 

We know now the configuration is tied up with each other. But it should not be. There should be a facility to configure comment  posting and ticket posting separately.

Note:
I am using cloud version.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1371].
  {panel}

Currently Service Desks pick up all messages in the mailbox they're connected to, regardless of the aliases configured for it. 

*Example:*
I set up a general SD with support@company.com.
Next I created a specific SD for a project and added support+project@company.com (gmail default aliasing).

Testing emails seemed to work nicely.
Then I added a third SD added support+project2@company.com and started sending a little more messages to the different aliases + general email address. 

There it got ugly: messages seemed to random be queued in the first available queue ending up spreaded over the desks, regardless the setup aliases.

Request: it would be nice if a single Service Desk would specifically target emails sent to a specific alias, when multiple Service Desks are connected to the same mailbox. That way 1 email account would suffice for multiple desks and making admins a whole lot happier and SD a lot easier to use.

*Workaround:* configure a separate mailbox for each Service Desk, and have the main mailbox forward emails to them based on the aliases.

fields.description:
When you have JIRA Automation in use with a Service Desk Project, even if you set some action to not send Notifications, they are sent.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:

# Configure JIRA Automation to trigger an issue transition and set it not to send Notifications
# The automation will work, but the customer get's the notification anyways

h4. Expected results:

The automation happens and no notifications are sent

h4. Actual results:

The notifications are being sent.

h4. Other information:

This issue was also reported at: https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automation/issue/37/service-desk-notifications-override
fields.summary: Notifications being sent with JIRA Automation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1366].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Added an agent <ayumi> to a JIRA Service Desk Project 
# Assign one issue to the agent 
# *Issues in progress* JQL under Service Desk > People 
{noformat}
assignee = ayumi AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PER
{noformat}
# Change the username of the agent to <adielle>
# *Issues in progress* JQL still shows 
{noformat}
assignee = ayumi AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PER
{noformat}
# Perform full indexing, the result is the same

*Expected Results*
*Issues in progress* JQL should update when the username changed 

*Actual Results*
*Issues in progress* JQL does not update when the username is changed

h3. Workaround
To manually change the name in JQL to reflect the correct result. 

h3. Additional Information
The number of issues in the People's view is reflecting correctly, only clicking it and redirect to the issue navigator shows the wrong username under the JQL.
fields.summary: Issues in progress JQL does not update when the username is changed

h3. Summary

Currently JIRA Service Desk does not offer any telephony support. It would be great if JIRA Service Desk could support telephony systems like ZenDesk currently does.

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call phone number assigned to JIRA Service Desk project
# Select severity level within IVR menu


h3. Expected Results
JIRA Service Desk opens a new ticket and alerts the appropriate users

 
h3. Notes

*ZenDesk Features - Voice*
- https://www.zendesk.com/product/features/voice

*Configuring ZenDesk Voice*
- https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203661476-Configuring-Zendesk-Voice



h3.Workaround
It is possible to leverage voicemail to email options in current telephony systems to send to a JIRA Service Desk email handler.
fields.summary: Voice Support in JIRA Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1361].
  {panel}

If an agent attaches a file to an issue and add a link to it on a comment, the customer will receive a notification of this comment containing the link. If the customer click on the link, Customer Portal homepage(Log in page) is opened instead of the attachment and user needs to log in.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Attach file to an issue
- Send a comment including the link
e.g. !code.png!
- Check notification e-mail and click on the link provided

However, after several tests we noticed that some links opened the attachment. Same attachment on different issues.

As we tested it, it redirects the user to JIRA log in page as they don't have enough permission to read the attachments.
fields.summary: The link to attachments on JIRA Service Desk notification is redirecting to Customer Portal

- Check notification e-mail in order to see the comment and the image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1356].
  {panel}

When an issue is submitted by email to the Service Desk mail handler, the default value is not applied to the issue for select lists if it is marked as optional.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a custom field called "contact type" that is a select list
# Add values of "helpdesk", "email", and "other"
# Set default value to be "email"
# Make the field visible in Service Desk, and mark as optional
# Submit request by email
# View issue and note that custom field is not present on issue in JIRA view

*Expected results:*
The value for "contact type" is email.

*Actual results*
It seems to ignore the field completely, and is not visible on the Issue View in JIRA
fields.summary: Custom field default values aren't applied to optional field in email submission
